reviews.review_msg: Daily vocabulary quizzes with fair tests. Very good at explaining the grammar and the group activities are very fun.

She is probably the best professor I have ever had in my time at SFU. She's kind, caring, and takes the time to explain things if you need it. I cannot recommend German 100 enough. She does vocabulary quizzes every class, however she HANDMAKES the Quizlets for you to study them. Take this class!!! So long as you try, you'll get an A.

One of the best professors I have had at SFU! She really cares for her students and makes learning German super fun. Claudia's lectures are engaging and interactive. Attending lecture really helped me absorb the material and made exams easy to study for.
Fantastic professor. Incredibly enthusiastic, and also unbeliavably organized. Taught German very well, but also taught us a lot about what it's like to live in Germany. The best!

Claudia is one of the best professors at SFU. She is very caring and goes above and beyond to help you out. I am very grateful I took 5 classes with her during my undergrad. I would recommend taking a class with her!

Dr. Hein was one of the best profs I've had at SFU. She is caring and makes learning German as fun as it can be. I always looked forward to her classes and I am sad I won't be able to take more. I highly recommend taking any German class with Claudia.
This class was fun and interesting.  It's fast paced and you learn a ton of grammar and important vocabularies.  Same textbook used for the next level.  Highly recommend Dr. Hein!

Claudia is an absolute gem of a prof. She genuinely wants her students to do well and is so caring--lots of participation marks are available as well as daily vocab quizzes. Her tests are fair taken straight from the outline she gives you and she's so so nice when answering questions regardless of what you ask. 100000/10 recommend taking her!
The best prof ever! Makes you feel like a friend more than a student, and I look forward to every class

Claudia is a kind, caring prof who wants to see you succeed! She is more than willing to answer your questions and make sure you understand the material. I'm so glad I took German 102 and 103 with her, and if I had enough room left in my degree I would take more.
Very kind and compassionate. She's willing to give help and always works with you when needed. Organization of some assignments can be a bit messy though.

Took 102, 103, 201, and 202 with Claudia and she made them as engaging, clear, and consistent as it is fun. She wants to see you speak German well! Note SFU dept cuts mean 300 is only allowed every two years. I had a 1.5 year gap between 202 and 300, but Claudia assured me 'das ist normal' to forget a little and got me up to speed in two weeks!

One of the VERY BEST professors I've ever had at SFU. She makes everything fun and engaging. Very understanding prof and goes out of her way to help! She has a good sense of humour as well. Just memorize the vocab for each lesson and the tests are designed for a beginner's level! Highly recommend if you get the chance.

Claudia is easily one of my favourite professors at SFU, she cares about her students and makes learning a new language fun and engaging. The class has vocab quizzes almost every class but if you study for these it helps translate to the tests. As long as you put in the effort to learning and practicing you should do well.

Took German with Claudia for three years, and I loved every class. She cares about you and your grade, and will try her hardest to help you out. She is clear about what are on the module tests, and always offers class time to review questions. Vocab quiz every class (she offers a Quizlet she makes herself) and a module test (3 units) every 2 weeks.

100% the best professor I ever had at SFU! She is super super nice, makes everything very clear, and gives lots of hints for the exams. She's very organized and punctual, and also very funny.  You can tell that she genuinely cares that her students learn and have fun in her class, and tries to make it as engaging as possible.  10/10 would recommend
The easiest course i've ever taken in SFU!

Awesome prof! Very nice and friendly, very clear, easy A if you do the homework (vocab tests every week, excercises, participation, 4 big tests, no papers, no final). Fun class (music, games, group works).

Claudia was great! Very engaging prof, lots of cultural knowledge since she's actually German. Easy marks from daily vocab quizzes. Learn the vocab, attend class, ask questions if you don't understand a point and you'll do fine. She is very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend!

Really nice lady, and wants her class to do well. However, I find that she does not spend enough time going over the important things and she rushes through every lesson and spends more time on useless things. It made for tests to be extremely difficult because she didn't thoroughly go over what we needed to know the most. Not a bad class though.

Not really great... had that "I don't want to teach" mentality though so I didn't find her anything special.  Writing was messy and she rushes through things.  Pros were that she showed music videos and she was never late.
Nice prof, but could have been better at introducing new vocab such as writing it on the board.  It was nice how she showed German music videos to the class to encourage discussion.
One of the BEST Prof in my entire SFU life!

Claudia is the best prof i met ever in SFU, enjoy her class so much. She makes the class fun and always available for extra help. If you follow her and do your HW , you will be fine in the exams, BTW, there is no final in her class : )

Claudia was an awesome professor! She had a fun and engaging way of learning a new language/culture. I loved the music videos she showed in class and her tests were good tests of our knowledge; fair marker I recommend this professor and course to anyone interested in learning a new language and who enjoys interacting with others in a group setting.

I enjoy the ways that Claudia teaches in both 102 and 103 sections, what you can learn not only the knowledge but also the cultures, a lot of interesting thing you cannot learn from the textbooks.Thanks to Claudia, her classes alleviate my stresses from my intense university life and make me delight!!I must take the 300 level class with Claudia.

Fabulous, absolutely fabulous. Claudia genuinely cares about her students. It is obvious that she puts a lot of thought into planning her lessons. We did a variety of role-playing, listening, and written activities which are all key in learning German. Anyone who says different evidently has no desire to learn the language.
MOST MEMORABLE PROF EVER IN SFU! Her instructions were clear and well-organized. We learned a lot and it is really useful.
One of the best courses I've taken, I would recommend it to anyone. Not only was the content interesting, the instruction was really clear and the instructor was always available for help.
Claudia has been excellent with her teachings in German and passionate not only with the course, but also with students. She made me look forward to further German courses next year.

Awesome prof!  Well, actually, I had her one time as a sub since Suzanne was sick or something and she was greeeeat! ~  She seems to enjoy her job lol.  I look forward to taking more german cuz of her A+++

GREAT PROF! lots of interaction with classmates! learn thru games and interviewing other people! Quizzes are easy! Tests are not hard! Homework online, question on facebook, and two exercises in book. Oral exam not hard at all, 5minutes. CLASS is actually fun! German lot of similarities to English (words+Grammar) taking Germ103 if she is teaching

SHE IS GREAT! Class is exciting and fun. Learn German by doing activities like interviewing other people with Deutsch. Lots of interaction with classmates! Board games, card games, etc. E-tutor easy. Quizzes and test straight forward. Oral Exam is only 5min long. Will definitely recommend her. plus, the Deutsch is very similar to English!!!!

Claudia was absolutely amazing! Class attendance is part of your overall grade, but you won't even want to miss class because it is actually fun, and since classes are small you get to know everyone. She is an extremely fair marker & assignments are not hard and she is flexible with deadlines. I would recommend Claudia and this class to anyone!

My favourite teacher so far at SFU. Extremely enthusiastic and helpful. Emphasizes spoken German, which, although intimidating, is extremely helpful. Engaging and funny, makes me want to take further German courses. If I have 1 criticism, it's that she's not very good with names, but she makes a genuine effort and is very endearing.

She is AMAZING. i want to be a critic, but she didnt do ANYTHING to allow me to. She is clear,extremely helpful, easy to learn from, funny and charming, she engages the class... This class took alot of work, but she made every bit of it enjoyable! I almost got stuck with a TA learning to teach, but switching to her actual class was SO worth it!

Very impressed with Claudia's constant enthusiasm in teaching & helping students in & outside class. I always felt motivated to go to class. Very easy-going, which encouraged me to constantly ask loads of questions (which are essential if you want to learn the language well!).  Claudia ist ausgezeichnet! :)
Claudia is a great professor whose classes are fun to attend. She is extremely helpful and brings in interesting material to class. Exams are fair- just study!

I love this prof. She's hilarious, totally involved in her class, and always comes up with interesting extra tidbits to share about her subject. She's also very good at adjusting or explaining the material in regards to questions in class.
her exams and grading style is a bit tricky but overall she is a v.good prof

Exams are bit tricky, but fair. About ppl who say she wants to hear only Ger. in class, save it for 202. As for favouring some over the others, I must say true (only a bit though). She favours ppl who submit work on time and punctual (typical German thinking). You get picked often for questions if she likes you :), take her for German if possible.
Very good.

Make sure you attend class..she doesn't like when students skip!  She tends to favour some students over others, which kinda shows.  She doesn't like when you speak english unless when it's for grammatical explanations, so speak german always!

Pretty much....Claudia was/is the best prof I have ever had. Sfu really sucks for profs(REALLY!) but Claudia made those semesters of absolute hell a little brighter. If you get into the class, and study just a tiny bit I guarantee you'll have a blast and possibly get a nice GPA boosting mark. (Hint: flashcards!)
Very good instructor. As for favoritism and arrogance - I haven't seen any. Maybe in other classes?

Claudia is the best languages professor I've ever had. She explains things in a clear and precise manner, making it easy to understand the difficult grammar concepts. As to favourtism, she's obviously going to favour her daughter. Also, she believes her daughter is better at German than her university students, which she is.
She creates a great  class environment. She loves teaching, and it shows. fair marker, great at explaining things. you won't regret taking a class with her, i promise.
very nice lecturer, fair grading, flexible, u will definitely enjoy learning German if u put some effort in it. claudia rocks!

Claudia is really the best prof. in SFU!! She is so funny, easy-going and super friendly. The way she teaches is so encourging and easy-to-understand. You will love her if you take her classes! She is super awesome! I just cant believe SFU has such a great prof! :)

Claudia is the best prof in SFU! She's so nice and helpful! She always gives students a lot of encouragement. I took Germ 102 as a elective and I'm glad that I took this course! Definitely I'll take her Germ 103 semester!
Very laid back and fun atmosphere for learning German. She's a hard marker but you know exactly what you need to work on.
She's the best prof in SFU. You will definitely enjoy her class. I'm gonna take her Germ 103 next term ^^
Very nice and encouraging prof. I really enjoyed her class and learned a lot. Best prof!!!

Frau Claudia is super nice, a really down to earth teacher.  She marks very critically, but it's all helpful stuff.  Overall a great teacher and makes German fun to learn. Adds a lot of insight into the culture to help us understand.
Took this course out of interest, and am very glad I did. Claudia was extremely helpful and encouraging, and just plain nice. Definitely an enjoyable class.
No Comments
You'll enjoy her class. Lots of fun!
Awesome Prof! you'll love her class!
